content.ContentService.name: ContentService
content.ContentService.doc: ContentService Service for returning text content from a script. You can serve up text in various forms. For example, publish this script as a web app. function doGet() { return ContentService.createTextOutput("Hello World"); } When visiting the web app URL you will see "Hello World" in the browser. Due to security considerations, scripts cannot directly return content to a browser. Instead, they must serve the content from a different URL. This is why the URL in the browser for output created via this web app will be different than the original script URL.

method.name: createTextOutput
method.doc: Create a new TextOutput object that can serve the given content.

content.TextOutput.name: TextOutput
content.TextOutput.doc: TextOutput A TextOutput object that can be served from a script. Due to security considerations, scripts cannot directly return text content to a browser. Instead, the browser is redirected to googleusercontent.com, which will display it without any further sanitization or manipulation. You can return text content like this: function doGet() { return ContentService.createPlainTextOutput("hello world!"); } There are also methods to serve JSON, RSS, and XML as TextOutputs; see the corresponding methods on ContentService.

method.name: append
method.doc: Appends new content to the content that will be served.

method.name: downloadAsFile
method.doc: Tells browsers to download rather than display this content.

argument.name: filename
argument.doc: the filename to tell the browser to use

method.name: getContent
method.doc: Gets the content that will be served.

method.name: getFileName
method.doc: Returns the file name to download this file as, or null if it should be displayed rather than downloaded.

method.name: getMimeType
method.doc: Get the mime type this content will be served with.

method.name: setContent
method.doc: Sets the content that will be served.

method.name: setMimeType
method.doc: Sets the mime type for content that will be served.

content.MimeType.name: MimeType
content.MimeType.doc: MimeType An enum for mime types that can be served from a script.
